Articles.Content:
Hi!

playing the game loads and loads since 0.24 i got used to having a simple multipurpose Smaller-Moon Lander with all the science equipment one needs. i used to put a Science Lab in low orbit of the mun and collect all the data, bring it to the lab and then cleaning the mystery goos and material bays. Then (when i have all the data from all bioms) i fly my lab home and get the data to Kerbins surface.

Building as usual in 1.0.4 poses a little problem now tho: i cant transfer the mystery goo and materials bay experiments anywhere. I just noticed that there is a "collectable" flag not checked with those two. So am i correct that there is no way of retrieving the data to its full potential without landing the Container itself?

If thats the case: if i am, say around Tylo right now, my mission-science ratio will take a serious hit, right?

How do you guys handle that change? Doesn't this kind of nullify the use of the "clean experiment"?

greez

Edited August 1, 2015 by Grossbeer
No, they can be collected, but you need a Scientist to rerun them. Or you may just have SETI installed.
damn your right, that is a SETI funtionality. That explains a lot thanks!

If you go to "..\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Squad\Parts\Science\GooExperiment" or to "..\Kerbal Space Program\GameData\Squad\Parts\Science\MaterialBay" you should find cfg file for each part.

It should contain line "dataIsCollectable = True". If that is there and game shows that you can't collect it, then it could be some mod, as mentioned in second post.

damn your right, that is a SETI funtionality. That explains a lot thanks!

I found the setting in SETI to change it. It's under "..\GameData\SETIctt\SETI-ScienceSettings.cfg" and "//---Part rebalance for Goo and Material".

I don't particularly like that I can't take them out, and I really don't understand the logic behind it. So, I'm changing it back, because it makes me sad.

I found the setting in SETI to change it. It's under "..\GameData\SETIctt\SETI-ScienceSettings.cfg" and "//---Part rebalance for Goo and Material".

I don't particularly like that I can't take them out, and I really don't understand the logic behind it. So, I'm changing it back, because it makes me sad.

I too am confuzzel'd over that one. I'm making that change as well.
